intro: Eugenia sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that is typically yellow or orange when ripe. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
